author: jinxjinx550
title: Useful City Guy
review:
When I first saw the thumbnail photo of this minifig, my reaction was "meh."  Another guy in a suit. 

But I find he's one of my favorites of the Series 8 group that I managed to snag today, because he's such a useful & iconic city figure.  The only "meh" thing about him is his standard-issue briefcase, in a color that I've been finding since the 1980s.

But not to worry, he has an excellent black bowler hat (almost part of a businessman's army, and just as useful), a nicely legible newspaper (City Financial Times), and a very nicely done business suit, with pinstriped shirt and purple tie.

Not flashy, not exciting or unique, but still a really nice addition to any city setting.  I'm very satisfied.

author: Topcop999
title: Useful parts.
review:
This minifig is probably overlooked a lot but is one you should definitely get...

Pros

  • Very good general Town/City torso. 
  • Highly detailed newspaper.
  • Bowler hat!

Cons

  • Bit pricey.
  • Lower quality plastic as with all CMF.
  • Not that easy to find with feel technique.

...Pick this one up if you can, I got it so I could make a Jeeves from a television programme called Jeeves and Wooster with the black bowler.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Doing Business Downtown
review:
Set #8833 Businessman: Some might think this is a bland offering from LEGO as there aren't very many unique new parts or printing with this Mini-Figure, I'd have to say those people are wrong.

The Businessman is a single-sided print Mini-Fig, his torso has a suitjacket on, complete with striped white undershirt and, of all things, a purple tie. The legs have no printing, the back has no printing and the facial print is single-sided only as well, with a pair of glasses and a great little moustache. Still he's a wonderfully welcome addition to the LEGO Collectible Mini-Figures line.

His accessories include a plain brown suitcase, similar piece found in many LEGO City sets, a 2x2 tile with newspaper print. (The financial section of the paper.) And he's wearing a bowler hat, that alone is enough to want to pick him up. This new hat piece is fun looking and great for MOCing some new Mini-Figures with Bowler hats, Charlie Chaplain, Dr. Watson to go with Series 5's Detective (AKA Sherlock Holmes) and any number of other custom Mini-Figures. Overall while the Businessman doesn't have much printing, what's here is very welcome indeed and I strongly recommend grabbing a few up for the bowler hat alone.

author: sideswinger
title: the PERFECT businessman!
review:
The eighth minifigure in the LEGO Minifigures Series 8 is the Businessman. He was released in 2012, retailed for three dollars, and includes 7 pieces. So let's take a closer look!

On top, we have that bowler hat that was new for the figure back in the day. It's simply a fantastic piece; I love how round it is, with the super smooth top, as well as the indention down by the rim. The surrounding rim is super great as well, and it's an extremely fitting business-esque hat that fits the figure nicely.

Next is his head, which has a fantastic expression. He sports some thin, black glasses and some brown eyebrows above them. Of course, that small but effective moustache is a very welcome part of his face, and I just love that down-to-business frown he has. He has no back facial printing, which is good since it'd be severely exposed due to that hat piece.

Next is his torso, which isn't anything too special; it's basically just a generic suit. I like that, though, as it fits the figure nicely. Of course that purple tie inside the black jacket is good, and he even has a bit of a white undershirt showing through as well. He has no back printing, though.

And his legs are just plain black with no printing, so let's move on to his accessories. The first accessory is that brown suitcase. It isn't anything new or exclusive, but it's extremely fitting, and I like how he has two accessories, anyway. That 2x2 newspaper, though, is amazing. It's so highly detailed, with the “city financial news” in that nice font, and I like that graph on it as well. The thing I like about it is that it wasn't even that necessary, and the fact that LEGO included it at all is fantastic.

That is it for this figure! Overall, this is not only a fantastic, fresh idea, but it's executed so well, with that new bowler hat, and even that 2x2 print. I like the little things about him as well, like the head, torso, and suitcase. So in the end, I'm gonna give this figure a 5, just because of how excellent the execution is. That's it for this review, thanks for reading!
